intro: Eugeniopsis teuscheriana, commonly known as the Tschudi's eugenia, is a small evergreen shrub native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces small, round berries that are typically dark purple when mature. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
